Salt_Lake_City.Henry Dinwoody House:
The Henry Dinwoody House, at 411 East 100 South, Salt Lake City, Utah, is a Late Victorian house that was designed by Richard Kletting, architect of the Utah State Capitol. It was built in 1890 and was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1974.
It was built as a home for Sara Kinersley, third wife of Mormon Henry Dinwoody.
